hours_text:
## Hours

#### Wednesdays through Sundays   
10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. 

#### Thursdays until 8:00 p.m.

## Admission

General

$7

Seniors (62+)  
Youths (3-18)

$5

Families  
(up to 2 adults and 4 youths)

$14

Children (2 and under)  
UO students, LCC students, faculty, staff*  
MNCH members  
Veterans and active-duty military*

Free

**OREGON TRAIL AND OTHER EBT CARD HOLDERS**  
The museum offers discounted admission to visitors presenting electronic benefit transfer (EBT) cards such as the Oregon Trail Card.

Individual: **$1**  
Families: **$5**

**Learn about all of our**[**free and reduced admission opportunities**](https://mnch.uoregon.edu/free-and-reduced-admission "Free and reduced programs")**.**

Our exhibits are fully wheelchair accessible. A wheelchair is available for visitor use on a first-come, first-served basis. Learn more about how we make our museum accessible by [clicking here](https://mnch.uoregon.edu/accessibility).

**K-12 FIELD TRIPS**  
Want to schedule a museum visit for your K-12 class?  
[Visit our K-12 programs page](https://mnch.uoregon.edu/k-12-programs-museum "K-12 Programs at the MNCH") to learn how. 

[**GROUP VISITS AND RATES**](https://mnch.uoregon.edu/learn/group-visits-and-tours)**|**[**SUMMER FIELD TRIPS**](https://mnch.uoregon.edu/summer-field-trips)

Learn more about group visits, guided tours, and group rates.

## Directions

1680 East 15th Avenue  
Eugene, OR 97403

The museum is located on 15th Avenue, between the Knight Law Cente...

collections_text:
Intro Text

##### **The Museum of Natural and Cultural History is a place for making connections****â€”****to each other, to our past, and to our future. It's a place for digging into science, celebrating culture, and joining together to create a just and sustainable world. We're glad you're here.**

[**Plan your visit**](https://mnch.uoregon.edu/visit "Plan your visit")**today.**

##  Oregon Stewardship Awards

The Oregon Stewardship Award recognizes an environmental or cultural project that inspires stewardship of our past, present, and future. 

[Learn More](/learn/oregon-stewardship-award)
